Multiple social media platforms: The video was shared on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Weibo, and Sina, which indicates its wide circulation and potential for misinformation.
Misleading caption: The video's caption falsely claimed that it showed a 102-year-old American who built his own helicopter. This discrepancy raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Reverse image search: Conducting a reverse image search on Google revealed that the same video was published on YouTube in 2013, titled "Ken Wallis," and described as showing the designer of the autogyro. This finding contradicts the claim made in the video.
Expert verification: The expert, in this case, determined that the claim was false and provided evidence to support their verdict. Their expertise adds credibility to the assessment of the video's authenticity.
